stories.text:
In AWS, we created public and private networks. Some services are only running in private network, but we have to make a server in public network and allow it to access the service in private network.

Maybe it should be proxy server? Does reverse proxy like nginx can be a solution for this case? If so, what's the core technical points?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to make a server for accessing internal network?

stories.text:
Alertmanager is a system to group, filter and dispatch alerts generated by Prometheus (and potentially more systems). The flow of alerts is configured via a tree of routes, each related with a receiver (e.g., email, PagerDuty, VictorOps, webhooks).

There are few realistic examples of Alertmanager configurations out there. How complex are your routes in Alertmanager? How many levels of routes do you have? Which labels do you group alerts on? With receivers do you use?
stories.title: Ask HN: How complex are your Alertmanager routes?
